subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Posted just a few new FB#12 files some interesting sweep rate answers
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
--0-888988521-1201200546=:93975
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Yeah all great ideas Ron. Our file area is filling up quick so I have been thinking of ways we can organize it. Eventually we will have a better system, we will have no choice but reorganize hehehe
   
  Misty

Ron Lederer <ronriko@...> wrote:
          Hi Misty   A filing idea.  It would be absolutely great if it were possible to have SUBJECT FILES for items such as 1) Technical info for RS Hacks, mini, FB etc.   2) messages regarding techs from the other side   3) Protection Ideas   4) other specific subjects but often asked question by new members like me.   I don't know what the capacity for all files is but setting up files on commonly asked questions would save newbees a lot of time as well as those helpful, experienced researchers who willingly answer the same questions over and over.  Newbees could refer to the subject list and move on.   Ron

Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...> wrote:         Cool will try and check those out. Hey Bruce can ya please make yourself one folder there in the main directory and call it Bruce's files or Bruce Halliday's EVP, trying to keep that section organized so its easier to find peoples stuff. You can make as many subfolders in your folder as you like, one for each box type if you like.
   
  Gonna do some cleaning on there soon and get rid of some of the ones that are no longer posting here or unjoined. Dont want to do that but we need the space. Im thinking of other alternatives for us to have more space tho in the future =)
   
  Misty

bhali333 <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
      Hey boy's and girls,

Here are some new Frank's box files. You may find the ones about sweep 
rate interesting.

There are quite a few good ones, New researchers please take note of 
the different sound between Frank's box and the RS boxes. The operation 
of the box and the sound and files it produces are very unique to each 
FB.

Bruce
